author: jessec
title: Project Catalyst Onboarding Hub
description: Project Catalyst lacks an engaging community hub with quick effective information to onboard new members.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal aims to create an educational hub for people to learn about the Cardano Ecosystem. From my understanding it seems the intent of the proposal is to focus on the general onboarding (as stated in the challenge description), but with the potential of further developing into highly active members of both Cardano and Catalyst. The proposal is meant to gather the learning resources that already exists within the Cardano Ecosystem, and collect them into a virtual learning hub. The proposal idea is definitely in alignment with the challenge criteria, but I would have liked to see more specifics on what makes the platform interactive with the new onboarding members. To clarify, how will the facilitators of the platform interact with the general public? Will there be ”guides” for helping people use the platform, or will there be teachers hosting their own workshops? In my opinion as experienced CA and Catalyst member there is great value in gathering resources in one place, and using already existing (and credible, of course) resources is a great way to make the ecosystem more unified and coherent. The proposal addresses the challenging aspect of keeping up with the rapid structural updates and development of Catalyst, which speaks of a good understanding of the Catalyst Ecosystem. 
Despite the proposal missing some details of how they aim to carry out the proposal (except for marketing and creating the learning hub with gathered resources), I would still agree that this proposal addresses most of the challenge criteria.
f6_assessments.q1:
The development team (two people) seem to inhibit enough expertise for this proposal to be successfully implemented. However, there is no links or references that verify their experience or expertise (LinkedIn, previous projects that were successfully implemented, etc). This information is important in order to measure the probability of the proposal being implemented. We do get a budget breakdown that is clearly presented, but it could also contain a bit more information. For example, will both team members be working on marketing, or how will the work be divided between the team? How many hours are estimated to be put into how large of a timeframe? 
Considering the budget for developing this project represents roughly 5% of the total challenge budget, I would deem the amount realistic for developing the intended proposal into product. As I mentioned under ”Impact”, there could be more details added containing how the proposal aims to present and run the hub. In my (intuitive and subjective) opinion, the proposal feel like more of an over-arching idea rather than a detailed plan/product. (I will happily stand corrected if people disagree). Overall, due to the reasons stated above, I disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal would benefit greatly by the inclusion of some detailed measurements of success or KPIs. There are mentions of what areas to educate new members on, but I have a hard time understanding how that information would relate to auditing the success of the project. Maybe it was misunderstood, somehow. In my opinion as a CA/vCA for several funds, I would have liked to see information on for example: ”By this time during development, we would have hoped to have had X amount of participants using our platform. 3 months later, we hope to have X times more, etc”.  Currently there is no mention of a total timeline in the proposal, so adding a roadmap with included milestones on a timeframe would benefit the quality of this proposal greatly. Maybe also give a short description on how/where the team will communicate with the Cardano/Catalyst participants? Will it be via social media, the platform itself or other places?  Conclusively, due to the lack of information provided in this proposal, I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: I love the idea of a hub built around videogame style interactive learning modules for Cardano and Catalyst, but it is important that this be either really well described, or have a good sample of work to base the model on.  There are many educational "hubs" for Cardano already, so differentiating yourself is step one, and providing some details on those differences is step two.  The proposal indicates the gamin will be part of the architecture, but no clues what that might look like (kid games?  FPS?  Sandbox), or of the implications to the technology stack for what they might choose.  I do like that well over half of the topics they listed fell under Catalyst.  Something I would like to see from anyone who seeks to create community educational resources, especially onboarding ones, is what is the plan to keep them current, to keep them maintained.  Education hubs and knowledge depots come and go in Catalyst, and either they succumb to sprawl, with so much content you can't find what you are looking for, or they become abandoned.  I am starting to come to the conclusion that the number one concern of any educational resource is their plan for sustainability.  This team seems to have a sense of that, because, almost as an afterthought, they add "stay up to date" in the last sentence of the proposal.  But no real explanation for how.
f6_assessments.q1: The first thing I want to see on any project that lists videogames on its roadmap, is the technology stack, but there isn't one included here.  It isn't totally clear, but it is possible that the games are for a later phase of the project.  For the online hub itself, I want to see some idea of the layout or general look and feel.  The team includes a link, but as of 3/20, it was just a start page on wordpress.  Ok, I can do a lot with a timeline and a budget, so I'll parse those.  No luck on the timeline, but the budget is present.  I would have liked to have seen more line items here, more breakdown of specific items, especially as one of them is labeled "world building" and I just talked myself out of needing to see the tech stack on this, but if world building doesn't refer to a game, what does it refer to?  A dedicated timeline, with the actionable steps clearly spelled out, and a budget with more than two line items is desperately needed by this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: We know that the deliverable here is some kind of an online community hub, but the scope really hasn't been established, and the timeline for its delivery is unknown, so I have no idea what the proposer can report on to achieve the monthly progress checks. Without a timeline for delivery, the funding tranches can't be set, so that is the first place to start. And if a better roadmap gets laid out, spelling out specific steps in a community buildout, those steps are a good start for useful KPIs.  Additionally, it is always recommended to opensource a project, which makes most auditability work a breeze, and gives high levels of transparency.  Because the rollout here is the community hub, it is expected that staying in touch with the proposer shouldn't be a problem either.

f6_assessments.q0: Although an interesting idea, this proposal is a little out of scope of current campaign. A virtual space might be a great idea for Cardano as a whole, but Catalyst is a very specific part of Cardano, where we need people to actively take roles in a governance system that can further shared success. Another community hub with a different approach might simply dilute Catalyst community making it harder to reach consensus. I would suggest refining this idea and proposing it in funds directed to general Cardano onboarding rather than Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1:
Although team has relevant experience, lack of timeline makes it hard to evaluate if a 2 person team with declared budget could achieve stated goals with sufficient quality. 
Plan is very general, with no timeline or milestones. I would propose to make a detailed plan that is laid out in time and connected to budget requirements.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditing the proposal will be hard due lack of milestones, timeline, KPIs, or clarity on actual deliverable.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a very simple yet interesting idea. Not only it will allow current members to learn more about Cardano and Project Catalyst and make well-informed decisions, but it might also attract new members who have an interest in cryptocurrency and blockchain but don't know where to start. This might also create a bigger sense of community, as the members will have a place to share information, discuss important topics and share their knowledge with newcomers.
However one of the challenges that should be considered is that, as in any participative environment, there needs to be some kind of mediation to make sure everyone is following the guidelines. Those open forums are prone to hate speech and bullying, and I believe there should be some focus on creating strict guidelines to avoid it.
f6_assessments.q1:
The idea itself doesn't seem overly complicated, but I would like more details on budget and timeline. It is a good thing that the material is already being gathered, but I would like more information about each step and how long it will take. The budget at a first glance seems a bit high, so I would like more explanation on how they came up with the numbers.
Both of the team members have relevant experience and seem to have the capacity to execute the project well, but I wish there were some links to verify their credentials.
f6_assessments.q2: I would like some more detailed KPIs. To me personally is not clear how success will be measured. There should be an estimate for example of how many active members they plan on getting, how much content, etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal presents a clear description of the problem, with a summarized solution that, with proper execution, can help to solve the described problem.

The development of a community hub focused on onboarding is an interesting way to address the questions proposed in the challenge. Some guiding questions would be uncovered, but other fronts would be addressed, such as improving the onboarding process and exploring the use of existing materials and content.

In this context, the author can further develop his proposal to seek to reach other fronts proposed by the challenge.

A point to think about is the similarities with other community or hub structures, such as forums that already exist. I understand that there is a clear difference in the proposal, which would be due to the format and interactivity of the content, but it is a point that is worth exercising thinking to understand which deficiencies of a format that can be covered by another. This is to avoid reproducing an old problem for a new solution.
f6_assessments.q1:
Despite having clarified the experience of those involved in the project, the author did not present relevant evidence about the team's experiences.

According to the skills required by the project, the indication is that they are able to develop, but as mentioned earlier, the proposal lacks evidence.

Regarding the informed budget, it would be interesting and necessary to obtain more detailed information about the composition of costs, even to understand if the budget allocated is sufficient to implement the project successfully.

As for the action plan, the information was not presented. The author only informed that regardless of fund allocations, the proposal will be carried out. Regardless of that, we need to know the steps involved in this process of developing, implementing and managing the Hub.

Another improvement that can be pointed out for this proposal is to better clarify (1) how the structure of this Hub will be, (2) what kind of information will be used for the onboard of members (3) what kind of support the new members will have during their passage by onboarding.

Regarding the risks, the author pointed out one of them. In addition to identifying other potential risks, the author can better clarify how he intends to mitigate the identified risk.
f6_assessments.q2:
The author has not established how the project audit process should take place. In place of guidelines to guide the community on how to monitor the project's progress, the author has listed topics that should be present in the Hub.

In addition, the document lacks the definition of indicators and milestones. This information, associated with the planning that was missing in this proposal, is essential for an effective audit process.

The project's vision of success elaborates a very generic perspective. At this point, the proposal could better clarify how onboarding will be approached within the platform.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is an another attempt to create a hub that is simply put, informs on everything Project Catalyst and fundamentals of Cardano. Not that it is not a good thing to have another hub, though how the proposer depicts this, their version of a hub is more likely a website rather than a hub like AVA Hub from the chain Avalanche. That's a proper hub that Catalyst can learn from.

The proposer has also shared a link to supposedly a similar project though nothing has been shared publicly regarding this project, which confuses me. Why would someone share reference of an unfinished project to ask funding's for a similar project?

There is also numerous instances that further confuses on the format of their solution. It is mention there will be a world building. So is it a metaverse? Is it a website? Is it a dashboard?
f6_assessments.q1: There is almost no possible way we can determine who these individuals are. There is no link that will assist the community to gauge the proposers capability in delivering their solutions. The website reference they provide is also still under construction. From their proposal details, they also seem to not be an active member of the community. Then there is their plan, which is no plan. No detailed timeline, no detailed budget are available for us to be brought along in their journey. Just numbers and pointers.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is inadequate. There is no plan, this includes their plan to report to the community. What is repeated consistently, is what they want to achieve in various ways of explaining. Is this due to that they have not been involved yet in the Cardano community is something unknown. Highly recommend these proposers to start small. Get more involved in the community and then get even more involved with Project Catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal precisely addresses the challenge and states a solution that is aligned with its purpose. An onboarding hub would greatly facilitate the newcomer’s experience and allow them to get up to speed faster and easier while greatly reducing the amount of people that are overwhelmed and driven away by excessive complexity.  I have many years of experience dealing with onboarding for big corporations and one of the most impactful things you can have is a “find it all in one place” project.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team seems to have what it takes to build the site, and support their community, also they are aware of the most critical risks. I suggest to the team to keep a close eye on the workload as it could quickly grow and require additional hands onboard that could be addressed by building partnerships early.
The plan is yet to include a detailed timeline and phases of the plan, it would have been easier to have one to understand how the team plans on executing. 
Since the proposal is only to get the hub up and running, the future operation will depend on future proposals’ funding.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team seems to have what it takes to build the site, and support their community, also they are aware of the most critical risks. I suggest to the team to keep a close eye on the workload as it could quickly grow and require additional hands onboard that could be addressed by building partnerships early.
The plan is yet to include a detailed timeline and phases of the plan, it would have been easier to have one to understand how the team plans on executing. 
Since the proposal is only to get the hub up and running, the future operation will depend on future proposals’ funding.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a project to build an educational hub for individuals to learn about the basic tools and functions of Cardano. I think this is a good idea and especially useful for new members. But as the proposer mentioned, the challenge is how to operate the hub effectively and keep the community updated with the latest information. Therefore, if there is a solution to this problem, the project will become more attractive.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer only said resources are currently being gathered to begin building but didn't give any detailed plan and timeline for delivering the solution. 
Team members information and experiences are listed. However, I would suggest you show more information like previous projects or a profile site for more accurate evaluation.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has only outlined the contents that will be built in the educational hub and there are no KPIs to evaluate the effectiveness of the hub after putting it into operation. There is no way to track the progress of this project. Giving specific target and metrics at each target is a good way to measure your project outcome

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer wants to create an education type hub to onboard new members. They give a brief description of the educational material and they address the problem of the challenge. Their website does not work at the time of this assessment, so I could not get any information there. I did look at their Twitter account, but this is more about NFT's. They basically have a good idea but much more information is needed on what and how they want to accomplish this. Elaborate more on what courses, how they will be produced and presented ,how will you get people to join the community.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers give a brief layout of their skills, but no links are provided to profiles. They do not mention any other team members that might be needed to work on the educational content. Please mention this next time. Layout  a road map with mile stones, when would you like to achieve what, and who would be responsible for what. Give their experience and skills to show that hey will be able to make the project a success. Also make mention of the resources you might need. 
If this increases your budget to much, break the project onto smaller pats. Give us the over all vision, but let us now that this will be step one - getting all the information, planning etc. What ever is needed. Your project will need much more than just one fund. The amount required is 5% of the overall Challenge budget which is prefect. But I don't believe it will cover the whole project. Prepare voters and advisors that more is to come.
f6_assessments.q2: Through providing a detailed road map with milestones, voters, community members and advisors will be able to track progress as long as milestones reached are posted or communicated somewhere like social platforms, Telegram and Discord etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal thinks that a quick effective information to introduce new members is lacking in Project Catalyst. Therefore  it proposes to create an educational hub for new members to learn about the basic Cardano tools and functions and their roles to affect the Cardano ecosystem through Catalyst.

The proposal lists the educational materials to be made available in the hub. This hub shall be marketed to the general public and it will be expanded in the future into a platform for projects and proposals.

The proposal believes that using interactive virtual environments should increase participants' ability to retain information and interest. It also thinks that it is more effective to divulge and receive information through interaction.

The proposer thinks that updates and changes in the catalyst would make the hub less effective.

I agree that interactive learning is a process necessary to get members who are totally new onboard very quickly. As such I strongly agree this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposed project will start when all the resources are gathered. This despite the funding allocation. The proposers do not have a layout plan and schedule to complete the project. 

They budgeted for the building of the communication hub 8k and marketing 2k, totalling 10k.

The project team comprises 2 members who have technical background and experience that are needed for the building. However, the marketing person is missing in the team.

Since they have not drawn out a plan and schedule and they have no marketing personnel in the human resource (and they have a budget for marketing), I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
Since their main objective is to onboard new members, the number on boarded over a certain period as a goal would give an indication of the project success. To further assess the progress, goals for number invited, numbers stay on board, numbers become active members, for example could add the credits to the proposal. 

The proposal has not set the goals, and without that, I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

solution: Launch a community hub to onboard and educate new members to the Project Catalyst ecosystem.
experience: Team has a working background in Communal Marketing structures that is being translated into virtual environments.
